Package ohos.ace.ability

Class AceAbility

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.app.AbilityContext
      • ohos.aafwk.ability.Ability
        • ohos.ace.ability.AceAbility
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAbilityContinuation, ILifecycle, Context

    public class AceAbility
extends Ability
implements IAbilityContinuation
    Child class of Ability. Any class specific to application running should derive from AceAbility.
    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.ACE.UIEngine

    • Method Detail

      • onStart

        public void onStart​(Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when an ability is started for initialization (it can be called only once in the entire lifecycle of an ability).

        Most initialization operations should be performed by calling this method. For example, you can use the current method to call Ability.setMainRoute(java.lang.String) and Ability.addActionRoute(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) to set the main router and action router for a Page ability.

        Overrides:
        onStart in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates information carried when this ability is started. Note: For a Service ability, null is passed.

      • onConfigurationUpdated

        public void onConfigurationUpdated​(Configuration newConfig)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called when the system configuration is updated.
        Overrides:
        onConfigurationUpdated in class Ability
        Parameters:
        newConfig - Indicates the updated configuration information.

      • onStop

        public void onStop​()
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back before an ability is destroyed.

        This method indicates the end of the ability lifecycle. It can be executed after the ability calls the Ability.terminateAbility() method or the last ability slice of the ability calls the AbilitySlice#terminate() method. Generally, this method is used to clear resources.

        Overrides:
        onStop in class Ability

      • onNewIntent

        public void onNewIntent​(Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called when the launch mode of an ability is set to singleInstance. This happens when you re-launch an ability that has been at the top of the ability stack.
        Overrides:
        onNewIntent in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates the new Intent containing information about the ability.

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed​()
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when the Back key is pressed.

        The default implementation destroys the ability. You can override this method.

        Overrides:
        onBackPressed in class Ability

      • onForeground

        public void onForeground​(Intent intent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when the state of an ability changes from BACKGROUND to INACTIVE.

        This is an intermediate state callback method. Generally, the system calls this method to refresh data status and then calls back the Ability.onActive() method.

        Overrides:
        onForeground in class Ability
        Parameters:
        intent - Indicates information carried when the ability returns to the INACTIVE state.

      • onBackground

        public void onBackground​()
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when an ability enters the BACKGROUND state.

        A Page ability in the BACKGROUND state is invisible. You are advised to suspend threads related to the ability and clear some resources to free up system memory.

        Overrides:
        onBackground in class Ability

      • onActive

        public void onActive​()
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when an ability enters the ACTIVE state.

        The ability in the ACTIVE state is in the foreground and is interactive.

        Overrides:
        onActive in class Ability

      • onInactive

        public void onInactive​()
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back when an ability enters the INACTIVE state (an ability in this state is not interactive and may change to the BACKGROUND or ACTIVE state).

        INACTIVE is an intermediate state and does not last for a long period of time. Frequent switching between ACTIVE and INACTIVE is possible. Therefore, you can use this method to perform certain simple operations, for example, committing any changes.

        Overrides:
        onInactive in class Ability

      • onStartContinuation

        public boolean onStartContinuation​()
        Description copied from interface: IAbilityContinuation
        Asks a user whether to start the migration.

        This method is called back when a local ability initiates a migration request.

        If the Ability does not implement this method, this Ability cannot be migrated, and false is returned. If the AbilitySlice does not implement this method, it does not affect whether its host ability can be migrated, and true is returned by default.

        Specified by:
        onStartContinuation in interface IAbilityContinuation
        Returns:
        Returns true if the user allows the migration; returns false otherwise.

      • onCompleteContinuation

        public void onCompleteContinuation​(int code)
        Description copied from interface: IAbilityContinuation
        Called back when a local ability migration is complete.

        You can define the processing logic after the migration is complete. For example, you can display a prompt to notify the user of the successful migration and then exit the local ability.

        Specified by:
        onCompleteContinuation in interface IAbilityContinuation
        Parameters:
        code - Indicates the migration result code, which is defined by the distributed system.

      • onSaveData

        public boolean onSaveData​(IntentParams saveData)
        Description copied from interface: IAbilityContinuation
        Saves the user data (carried in the IntentParams object) of a local ability generated during runtime. After the migration is triggered and the local ability is ready, this method is called when the Distributed Scheduler Service requests data from the local ability.
        Specified by:
        onSaveData in interface IAbilityContinuation
        Parameters:
        saveData - Indicates the user data to save.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is successfully saved; returns false otherwise.

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent​(TouchEvent event)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called when a touch event is dispatched to this ability. The default implementation of this callback does nothing and returns false.
        Overrides:
        onTouchEvent in class Ability
        Parameters:
        event - Indicates information about the touch event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the event is handled; returns false otherwise.

      • onKeyDown

        public boolean onKeyDown​(int keyCode,
                         KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called when a key is pressed. When any component in the Ability gains focus, the key-down event for the component will be handled first. This callback will not be invoked if the callback triggered for the key-down event of the component returns true. The default implementation of this callback does nothing and returns false.
        Overrides:
        onKeyDown in class Ability
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Indicates the code of the key pressed.
        keyEvent - Indicates the key-down event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this event is handled and will not be passed further; returns false if this event is not handled and should be passed to other handlers.
        See Also:
        Ability.onKeyUp(int, ohos.multimodalinput.event.KeyEvent)

      • onKeyUp

        public boolean onKeyUp​(int keyCode,
                       KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called when a key is released. When any component in the Ability gains focus, the key-up event for the component will be handled first. This callback will not be invoked if the callback triggered for the key-up event of the component returns true. The default implementation of this callback does nothing and returns false.
        Overrides:
        onKeyUp in class Ability
        Parameters:
        keyCode - Indicates the code of the key released.
        keyEvent - Indicates the key-up event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if this event is handled and will not be passed further; returns false if this event is not handled and should be passed to other handlers.
        See Also:
        Ability.onKeyDown(int, ohos.multimodalinput.event.KeyEvent)

      • onRestoreData

        public boolean onRestoreData​(IntentParams restoreData)
        Description copied from interface: IAbilityContinuation
        Restores the user data saved during the migration for an ability on the remote device immediately after the ability is created on the remote device. Lifecycle scheduling for the ability starts only after the user data is restored.
        Specified by:
        onRestoreData in interface IAbilityContinuation
        Parameters:
        restoreData - Indicates the user data to restore.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the data is successfully restored; returns false otherwise.

      • setInstanceName

        public void setInstanceName​(String name)
        Sets an instance name.

        The instance name must be the same as the module.js.name value in config.json.

        • If the value is MainAbility, call this method in the onStart method of the Ability instance to set the instance name to MainAbility.
        • If the default value is retained, you do not need to call this method to set the instance name for the Ability instance.

        Note that this method must be called before the super.onStart method.

        For an application with multiple instances, the module.js field contains more than one name items. You need to identify the item for the current instance.

        Example code:

         public class MainAbility extends AceAbility {
     @Override
     public void onStart(Intent intent) {
         setInstanceName("MainAbility");
         super.onStart(intent);
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the instance name. The value cannot be an empty string. Otherwise, your application cannot run properly.
        Since:
        3

      • setPageParams

        public void setPageParams​(String url,
                          IntentParams params)
        Sets page parameters.

        You can use this method to set the home page URL and parameters. After the home page is successfully loaded, you can use this.xxx (xxx: a parameter key) to obtain the parameter values. Note that this method must be called before the super.onStart method.

        Example code:

         public class MainAbility extends AceAbility {
     @Override
     public void onStart(Intent intent) {
         IntentParams intentParams = new IntentParams()
         intentParams.setParam("key1", value1);
         String url = "pages/index/index";
         setPageParams(url, intentParams);

         super.onStart(intent);
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        url - Indicates the page URL to set, which is an item in the pages clause of the config.json file.
        params - Indicates the page parameters to set.
        Since:
        3

      • pushPage

        public void pushPage​(String url,
                     IntentParams params)
        Navigates to another page in the application based on the page URL and parameters.

        After the page is successfully loaded, you can use this.xxx (xxx: a parameter key) to obtain the parameter values. Do not call this method in the onStart method.

        Example code:

         public class MainAbility extends AceAbility {
     @Override
     public void onNewIntent(Intent intent) {
         IntentParams intentParams = new IntentParams();
         intentParams.setParam("key1", value1);
         String url = "pages/index/index";
         pushPage(url, intentParams);
     }
 }
        Parameters:
        url - Indicates the page URL, which is an item in the pages clause of the config.json file.
        params - Indicates the page parameters.
        Since:
        3

      • onRequestPermissionsFromUserResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsFromUserResult​(int requestCode,
                                               String[] permissions,
                                               int[] grantResults)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called back after permissions are requested by using AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int).
        Overrides:
        onRequestPermissionsFromUserResult in class Ability
        Parameters:
        requestCode - Indicates the request code passed to this method from AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int).
        permissions - Indicates the list of permissions requested by using AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int). This parameter cannot be null.
        grantResults - Indicates the granting results of the corresponding permissions requested using AbilityContext.requestPermissionsFromUser(java.lang.String[],int). The value 0 indicates that a permission is granted, and the value -1 indicates not.

      • onAbilityResult

        protected void onAbilityResult​(int requestCode,
                               int resultCode,
                               Intent resultData)
        Description copied from class: Ability
        Called when Ability.startAbilityForResult(ohos.aafwk.content.Intent,int) is called to start an ability and the result is returned.

        This method is called only on Page abilities. You can start a new ability to perform some calculations and use Ability.setResult(int,ohos.aafwk.content.Intent) to return the calculation result. Then the system calls back the current method to use the returned data to execute its own logic.

        Overrides:
        onAbilityResult in class Ability
        Parameters:
        requestCode - Indicates the request code returned after the ability is started. You can define the request code to identify the results returned by abilities. The value ranges from 0 to 65535.
        resultCode - Indicates the result code returned after the ability is started. You can define the result code to identify an error.
        resultData - Indicates the data returned after the ability is started. You can define the data returned. The value can be null.
